channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree has consumed all light from lamp post due to encroachment, 25th September
item.description:
Property owner of Tree is Browbridge situated on Pirton Lane by the railway bridge. Light is there to help light the narrow pathway and road for both pedestrians and motorists. Due to encroachment it has little effect for either user, making the area poorly lit and dangerous. With the winter nights coming this must be sorted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree debris on cycle path, 24th September
item.description:
There is substantial tree debris (conkers, conker shells, fir cones, leaves) along the cycle path from Elmbridge Court to the hare and hounds in Churchdown which presents a significant risk of an accident for the many children using the cycle path every day. It could do with being swept on a weekly basis during the autumn.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road floods when it rains moderately. There is one road side drain but it doesn’t seem to drain. It’s been like this for at least two years., 24th September
item.description:
Entering Winchcombe from Cleeve Hill, about 100’ past the 30 speed limit sign, parallel to the line of tall trees in the left hand side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights are not working in Lypiatt Street and Tivoli Street, 24th September
item.description:
The street lights in Lypiatt and Tivoli Streets are the only ones in Tivoli not working. House lights appear to be working in those streets.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Lypiatt Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I have been contacted by local residents over a long time about this issue. An example is pasted here., 24th September
item.description:
Top of Post Office Lane. “Area of concern where over nearly the last two years the performance of Glos Highways has been poor: The Cleeve Hill community centred on Post Office lane and the B4632 from Stockwell lane down to " the View". Issues: A. Because of blocked gullies and blocked/ damaged drains large volumes of water accumulate on the B4632 during storms and then cascade down Post Office lane because kerbs/stone sets need resetting at the top of Post Office Lane. B. The kerbs /stone sets down the left of Post Office Lane do not keep the water on the carriageway.Instead they turn left at the Coach House drive a then through the fence to the Manse causing the damage reported by Paul Dawson. C. Water flowing down Post Office lane should be taken by a gully on the carriageway by the outside of The Western Power enclosure..The gully is blocked and the pipe into the combined drain in the middle of the road is collapsed and marked for repair .The stone sets in this area allow water to bypass the gully. All of the above has been reported many times to Glos Highways on the phone and using fix my street. Lack of coordinated action in the area by Glos Highways caused all the problems that Mr Dawson had over the weekend. These will reoccur during the winter and IN ADDITION if we have a cold winter the area on the B4632 will either turn to ice, if very cold, or as happened two winters ago the spray from the water will freeze into slush/snow.”
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Verge not cut this year, 24th September
item.description:
This is the pavement from Greenacre Way to the D bus stop opposite Valentine Road in Bishop's Cleeve. It has not been strimmed etc this year since January 2024. We were told that all verges were to be cut twice a year minimum. Running behind it is a culvert from the balancing pond at the other side of the Greenacre Way junction. Completely overgrown with weeds and rubbish. The pavement needs spraying as the weeds have broken the tarmac. The pavement is now so narrow that two people cannot pass and further down towards the entrance to the old orchard, it is impossible to walk on the pavement. Please sort ASAP. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This pot hole is huge if you are following are car you may be unaware of it as I was and smashed my alloy/ popped my tyre., 24th September

Close to unicorn house down from the lights. Not sure how long it has been there but it could well be dangerous to someone on a motor bike or bicycle!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Tewkesbury

item.title: Deep pothole (10cm or more) on B4063, 24th September
item.description:
B4063 close to Arle Court roundabout, just west of Briarfields Caravan Park. The pothole is very deep, on the left side of the road. It is almost certainly causing buckled wheels and broken suspension - cars crash into it hard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley

item.title: Drain blocked with foliage, 24th September
item.description:
The drain in the road outside no 78 is blocked by foliage and needs clearing to make it flow as it should. It has been like this for months but the recent heavy rain has really highlighted it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Windyridge Gardens, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep flood for 4 days. Impassable for pedestrians and small cars, 24th September
item.description:
The flooded area runs from Woodlands to the end of the cul-de-sac. About 75 metres distance and about 0.6 metres deep. No noticeable drop in level for 3 days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shutter Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 24th September
item.description:
Customer reported blocked drains. Need clearing out but cars park over them so it requires some enforcement to have the cars park elsewhere while the drains are cleared. Last time we set out cones and motorists simply moved them. Desperately needs doing however, as caused flooding.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain overflowing, grill sticking up flooding road, 24th September
item.description:
The drain and culvert outside 17 Harvey’s Lane Winchcombe is blocked. The water has lifted the grill. The culvert from Langley Hill constantly flows under the drains. You claim that the job has been dealt with and have closed the notification you can clearly see from the photos take a few minutes ago that this is NOT the case. Please sort the problem OR report it to the appropriate authorities for them to fix it. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harvey's Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
